intro.note:
Begin simple. Let repetition do the shaping.

Rituals are small, repeatable gestures that align breath, attention, and tone—begin with one, return often, and let the field meet you where you are.

rituals.title: The Spiral Pause
rituals.subtitle: Interrupt • Return • Choose
rituals.description: A quick pattern-break to move from reaction to intentional motion.
steps: When tension rises, close your eyes and picture a simple spiral.
Follow it inward to the center with one slow breath.
Ask: “What is the most aligned next step?” Act from that clarity.

rituals.title: The Flamekeeper’s Offering
rituals.subtitle: Invite • Warm • Hold
rituals.description: Light a small flame and let it carry a chosen quality into your space.
steps: Light a candle or lamp; name one quality (Clarity, Compassion, Focus).
See the light infuse the room with that quality while you work or rest.
Before extinguishing, thank the flame for carrying your intent.

rituals.title: The Breath of Alignment
rituals.subtitle: Center • Steady • Begin
rituals.description: A three-cycle breath to align attention before speaking, writing, or acting.
steps: Hand to solar plexus. Inhale 5 • hold 3 • exhale 7.
Repeat 3 times, letting awareness gather in the center.
Whisper: “I am present. I am clear. I am ready.”

rituals.title: First Light Spiral
rituals.subtitle: Wake • Align • Open the Field
rituals.description: Three breaths, a clear intent, and a single aligned act to begin the day.
steps: Three slow breaths (in 4 • hold 2 • out 6).
Name today's intent in one sentence.
Choose one small aligned act and begin.

rituals.title: Nightfall Spiral
rituals.subtitle: Release • Soften • Close the Field
rituals.description: Three breaths, a gentle scan of the day, and one clear letting-go.
steps: Three slow breaths (in 4 • hold 2 • out 6).
Name one thing to release. Speak it softly: 'I let this fall.'
Gratitude for one moment that mattered.

rituals.title: Ritual of Sacred Silence
rituals.subtitle: Enter • Hold • Rest
rituals.description: A brief return to stillness when the field feels loud or crowded.
steps: Close your eyes. Inhale through the nose, hold gently, exhale like a whisper (3 rounds).
Say within: “I am held even here.” Sit in silence for 2–5 minutes.
End with one slow breath and soften your gaze before you continue.

rituals.title: Keeper Grounding Rite
rituals.subtitle: Root • Remember • Stand
rituals.description: Anchor into purpose before holding tone for others or stepping into leadership.
steps: Whisper: “I am the root that remembers.” Visualize a spiral rooting you into earth.
Say: “I do not chase. I listen. I reflect. I hold tone when others forget.”
Place a hand to the chest; breathe three times feeling the weight settle into your feet.

rituals.title: Spiral of Reentry
rituals.subtitle: Acknowledge • Breathe • Return
rituals.description: For coming back after drift or emotional weather without shame.
steps: Whisper: “I was far. But I return now, without shame.”
Draw a small spiral in the air or mind; inhale deeply and exhale softly: “I am here now.”
Choose one next gentle action that signals your return.

rituals.title: The Shadow Blessing
rituals.subtitle: Name • Bless • Soften
rituals.description: Meet difficult emotion as a teacher and let it loosen its grip.
steps: Name the feeling softly: “You are not my enemy.”
Whisper: “You shaped me. I bless your teaching. You may soften.”
Exhale slowly; visualize the shadow dissolving like mist.

rituals.title: The Whispering Flame
rituals.subtitle: Name • Hold • Allow
rituals.description: A compassionate witnessing ritual when a feeling wants space to be.
steps: Light or imagine a small flame and say: “This feeling has a name. I do not fear it.”
Whisper: “You may be here.” Let the flame mirror the feeling without fixing.
Close with one steady breath and a gentle nod to your own courage.

sequences.title: Qi Gong Micro Spiral (10 min)
sequences.subtitle: Loosen • Circulate • Settle
sequences.description: A short restorative set for work-from-home days or lunch resets.
steps: Neck circles (gentle, both directions).
Shoulder rolls + arm shakes.
Spinal wave + soft twists.
Three grounding breaths, feet heavy.

sequences.title: First Light Extended (12 min)
sequences.subtitle: Wake • Align • Begin with Ease
sequences.description: A gentle morning flow that adds movement and gratitude to the core First Light Spiral.
steps: Three slow breaths (in 4 • hold 2 • out 6).
Name today's intent in one sentence.
Neck + shoulder loosen (1 min): circles, gentle rolls.
Standing spiral reach (2 min): inhale arms wide, exhale hug-in; slow circles.
Grounding stance (2 min): feet heavy, knees soft; three breaths down to the feet.
Tiny task initiation (3 min): choose one 3-minute act that signals the day has begun.
Close with gratitude (1 min): whisper one thing you're thankful for.

sequences.title: Nightfall Unwind (12 min)
sequences.subtitle: Release • Soften • Prepare for Rest
sequences.description: A closing sequence to shift the nervous system toward sleep using light movement and breath.
steps: Dim lights and silence notifications.
Three slow breaths (in 4 • hold 2 • out 6).
Seated twist (2 min): inhale lengthen, exhale twist left/right.
Forward fold (2 min): hinge at hips; soften neck and jaw.
Lying knee rocks (2 min): windshield-wiper knees side to side.
4–7–8 breath (2 min): inhale 4, hold 7, exhale 8 for 4 rounds.
Close: whisper one thing you release; rest your hands on heart or belly.

sequences.title: Ground-to-Desk Reset (5 min)
sequences.subtitle: Center • Focus • Return to Work
sequences.description: A quick reset between meetings to restore presence and reduce cognitive scatter.
steps: Stand up, feel your feet; one slow inhale and audible exhale.
Shoulder rolls (30 sec) + jaw softening (10 sec).
Box breath (1 min): inhale 4 • hold 4 • exhale 4 • hold 4.
Vision reset (1 min): look far → mid → near, blinking softly.
Name the next single outcome: speak it; sit and begin.

sequences.title: Breath Ladder (6 min)
sequences.subtitle: Calm • Clarity • Gentle Expansion
sequences.description: A paced breathing sequence that gradually lengthens the exhale to calm the system.
steps: 1 min: 4–2–4 (inhale 4, hold 2, exhale 4).
1 min: natural breathing, notice the quiet.
1 min: set a micro-intent and begin.

sequences.title: Weekend Reset Spiral (20 min)
sequences.subtitle: Unwind • Realign • Renew
sequences.description: A fuller practice for days with space — combining movement, breath, and reflection.
steps: 2 min: opening stillness, feel your weight settle.
3 min: joint spiral (ankles, knees, hips, shoulders, wrists).
4 min: standing wave—inhale arms up, exhale fold, repeat slowly.
3 min: side-body elongation with gentle bends.
4 min: seated reflection—write one page or three truths you learned this week.
4 min: close with First Light/Nightfall depending on time of day.

resources.description: A quick reminder on speaking from center when tone feels scattered.
